thread.title: Ground News - India’s agonising wait for historic first remains amid all-time thrashing by SA
thread.title_full: Ground News - India’s agonising wait for historic first remains amid all-time thrashing by SA

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - India’s agonising wait for historic first remains amid all-time thrashing by SA
text:
Summary by Ground News South Africa beat India by an innings and 32 runs in Centurion. Virat Kohli top scored for India with 76 but the rest of the batting collapsed. Dean Elgar (185) and Marco Jansen (84 not out) transformed a slender 11-run lead for South Africa at the start of play. Share menu More
Filters 1 Articles 1 Articles All Left Center Right
Fox Sports Australia Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Murdoch Family Media Conglomerate: Telstra India’s agonising wait for historic first remains amid all-time thrashing by SA India’s dream of winning a Test series in South Africa for the first time was ended inside three days as they crashed to an innings and 32 runs defeat at SuperSport Park in Centurion on Friday (AEDT).
